content: take-tac-go skill level easy materials worsted weight yarn of your choice in two or more colors you ll need approximately 3 ounces of the main/motif color and an ounce of your contrast color for the xs and os size h 5 0 mm hook for gameboard/carry pouch size i 5 5 mm hook one button 1 to 1 25 inches 2 5 to 3 2 cm in diameter and appropriate thread and needle for sewing it on tapestry needle for weaving ends abbreviations chain chain stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch yo yarn over special stitches decrease insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through yo and pull through all 3 loops on the hook 1 decrease counts as 1 single_crochet notes you may prefer to use a sturdy acrylic for this pattern since it can then be washed easily if needed this pattern can be worked with any weight yarn and an appropriate hook bigger yarn/hook will produce a bigger piece as written the finished gameboard is approximately 7 5 inches 19 cm square the xs and os are approximately 1 5 inches 3 8 cm across gauge is 4 single_crochet and 4 row = 1 inch but it isn t terribly important…what you re looking for is the combination of hook and yarn that will give you nice flat pieces for the gameboard and pouch the motifs are worked in spirals do not join rounds you may find it useful to mark the first stitch of each round take-tac-go crochet pattern is copyright 2008 by deborah ellis please do not reproduce this pattern xs make 5 with smaller hook first arm chain 5 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across 4 slip_stitch second arm chain 4 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across 3 slip_stitch and in last chain sl stitched in on first arm starting chain for the whole x 4 slip_stitch third arm repeat second arm final arm repeat second arm clip yarn leaving a tail at least 6 inches long pull tail back through work so that it is held to the front of your x chain 1 then pull end through that chain st to fasten_off thread tail onto tapestry needle and pull knot back through center of x and weave in ends os make 5 chain 7 join with slip_stitch to form ring chain 2 then make 20 half_double_crochet in ring 21 half_double_crochet slip_stitch in top chain of chain 2 fasten_off and weave in ends gameboard with larger hook square motif make 9 round 1 chain 4 11 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook 12 double_crochet round 2 single_crochet in top chain of round
